text:
is there any downside to using slurping to catch unused arguments? e.g.
```foo(a,b,c,d,e) # uses all arguments
foo(a,unused...) # uses only one arg```

elements.text: is there any downside to using slurping to catch unused arguments? e.g.

foo(a,b,c,d,e) # uses all arguments
foo(a,unused...) # uses only one arg

text: why would caller call the function with more than 1 argument if the rest are ignored?

text: Typically, the convention is to use `_` instead of `unused`, which is also special-cased in lowering for some instances and can sometimes allow the compiler to better eliminate dead code.
